verbs.description: decap (third-person singular simple present decaps, present participle decapping, simple past and past participle decapped)

entries.meaning: (biology) To enzymatically remove a cap from mRNA.
(hardware) To remove the epoxy from an integrated circuit.
(military, chiefly nautical) To cause an armor-piercing shell to lose its hardened cap, degrading its ability to penetrate armor.
